content: Yes, it was definitely a more challenging course than what we're used to today. In fact, only 7 of the 19 athletes who started the race were able to finish it. But it's also worth noting that the athletes who competed in the 1900 Olympics had a very different approach to training and nutrition than modern-day athletes, so they were likely better equipped to handle the challenges of the course. Nonetheless, it's amazing to think about the early pioneers of the marathon and the endurance it took to complete those early races.
